top_entities.name: Autoimmune lymphoproliferative syndrome-recurrent viral infections due to CASP8 deficiency

title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndromes: Epidemiology and Clinical Manifestations
short_description: Clinical overview of Ehlers-Danlos Syndromes (EDS) covering incidence rates, age of diagnosis, and prevalence of different subtypes.
long_description: This document provides comprehensive epidemiological data on Ehlers-Danlos Syndromes (EDS), a group of connective tissue disorders. It details the variable age of diagnosis from childhood onwards, overall incidence estimates ranging from 1/2,500 to 1/5,000 births, and specific prevalence rates for major subtypes including hypermobile EDS (hEDS), classical EDS (cEDS), and vascular EDS (vEDS). The document also addresses diagnostic challenges due to underreporting of mild cases and provides detailed statistics on rare subtypes such as kyphoscoliotic EDS (kEDS), arthrochalasia EDS (aEDS), and dermatosparaxis EDS (dEDS), with some variants identified in only single families.
